description: The William Chrisman boys basketball team bounced back from a close semifinal loss Friday to take third place in the Kaminsky Classic.

description: The Kansas City Chiefs did what they had to Saturday, beating the Broncos on the road to finish up the regular season.

name: Two newcomers help Mavericks bounce back from loss with rout of Tulsa
description: When Mavericks coach Tad O'Had woke up Sunday morning, he was still disappointed following Saturday's 2-1 loss to Wichita at Cable Dahmer Arena.

description: One CDC metric for high community transmission is 100 or more new cases per 100,000 population in the past seven days. The county Health Department lists its current number at 937 for Eastern Jackson County,

description: Nearly stumbling heading into the playoffs, Nick Bolton and the Kansas City Chiefs gathered themselves just in time.

description: The top Democrat in the Missouri Senate has filed legislation to repeal parts of a new state law forbidding local police from enforcing federal gun laws. Senate Minority Leader John Rizzo, D-Independence,

name: In the long run, Russia is not America's great rival
description: Russia is demanding that the U.S. give formal assurances that Ukraine and Georgia will never be admitted to NATO, and no nation bordering Russia will ever accept offensive NATO weapons that could imperil Russia's security.

name: Missouri COVID hospitalizations set record as cases surge
description: The state Department of Health and Senior Services said 3,235 people were hospitalized with the virus statewide and about 15% of the state’s hospital beds remained available.

name: Justin Woods' return helps spark Mavericks to third straight win over Wichita
description: A week ago, former Mavericks fan favorite Justin Woods was back home in Fairbanks, Alaska, hitting the ice, getting in shape and hoping for a call.

name: Kenneth Kieser: National Fishing Expo comes to Kansas City
description: I am impressed with the show that will be in Kansas City Jan. 14-16. The National Fishing Expo will feature many top professionals from different types of fishing talking about their craft and these seminars are free except for a moderate entrance fee.

name: Broncos' Drew Lock focuses on Chiefs, not on his future
description: Drew Lock said he's not out to beat his hometown Chiefs or end Denver's 12-game losing streak to Kansas City, but simply to get a victory.

name: 2022 Sentry Tournament of Champions odds, picks and PGA Tour predictions
description: The 2022 portion of the PGA Tour's wraparound schedule begins at the Sentry Tournament of Champions in Kapalua, Maui, Hawaii, Thursday after taking a few weeks off for the holidays. The champions from last season will tee it up at the Plantation Course at Kapalua Resort,

name: The Big Truth of America's singular genius
description: Biden countered the Big Lie pushed by the man he called – 16 times! – our “former president” by telling more directly in public than ever before what Trump has been willing to do to our democracy to avoid being labeled the 2020 election loser.

description: The Fort Osage wrestling team came into Wednesday’s Suburban Middle Six Conference matchup against Grain Valley shorthanded.

description: Fort Osage High School graduate Skylar Thompson will return from an ankle injury to start at quarterback for Kansas State in the Texas Bowl tonight.

name: Truman grad Josh Patrick cleans up at Ban Johnson League awards, finds new college baseball home
description: Josh Patrick cleaned up with major awards at the Ban Johnson Collegiate Baseball League banquet last week. And that came right after he found a new baseball home. The Truman High School graduate and Crowder College player won the Ban Johnson League’s Bob Allison Offensive Player of the Year award and the Lester Milgram Most Valuable Player Award.

description: The project will affect traffic on Gudgell between Dodgion Avenue (a block east of Noland Road) and Kingshighway (at the Independence Manor Care Center),

description: Patrick Mahomes sees the regular-season finale at Denver on Saturday as a way for the Kansas City Chiefs to tune up for another long playoff run.

description: The advances technology has made are great, but can't someone just give the baby boomers a break and provide instructions in lingo we can understand?

description: The stock market had another fantastic year, by most measures. However, it was a bifurcated market that saw many names with large declines under the surface of the headline indices.

name: Retirement plan: Internship at Disney World
description: Dave Gramling is closing his barber shop in Grain Valley Jan. 27 and will begin a new chapter of his life as a 64-year-old intern at Disney World.

name: Chrisman's Herl brothers reunite at Kaminsky Classic
description: On Thursday afternoon, Dawson was sitting courtside as his younger brother led William Chrisman to a 60-42 victory over Carl Junction in the opening round of the Kaminsky Classic at Joplin High School.

description: The 20-member commission held the constitutionally required public hearing on its proposed plan for 163 House districts on Monday morning in Jefferson City. The tentative plan submitted Dec. 23 shows agreement on 112 of 163 districts,

description: They have also been football and basketball teammates since they played in Blue Springs youth leagues. Now, they are starring for the 7-2 Blue Springs High School basketball team that is off to a strong start,

name: Independence says no to showers for homeless
description: The Rev. Sarah Wimberley, president of the Ministerial Alliance, said the idea for the donation – $100 to be used as $5 vouchers to allow shower use over the course of a year, with more funds if necessary – came from the ongoing discussion of the challenges with the city's houseless population.

name: Chiefs likely without RB Edwards-Helaire again vs Broncos
description: The Kansas City Chiefs will likely be without running back Clyde Edwards-Helaire for the second straight week when they visit the Broncos on Saturday.

name: Independence council rejects handing over power plant to settle lawsuit
description: A company fighting the city of Independence in court wanted the old Blue Valley power plant and a tax abatement in exchange for dropping its lawsuit.

name: Area COVID-19 vaccination sites
description: Vaccinations are being given at both locations, Mondays through Fridays of from 7 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. You must make an appointment in order to receive the vaccination by calling 816-404-2273 or by visiting    Jackson County Health Department:   If you have any question about Jackson County Health Department vaccine clinics or are having difficulty registering for an appointment,

name: Eastern Jackson County COVID levels still high and rising
description: The Jackson County Health Department lists 555 new COVID-19 cases per 100,000 people in the community – far above the figure of 100 that the CDC uses as a measure of high community transmission.

name: Independence man sentenced to 25 years on gun and drug charges
description: A federal judge sentenced Brandon L. Hill, 33, to 25 years without parole for illegally possessing firearms, including stolen guns, and drug trafficking in three separate instances.

name: Needlessly exposed in a moment of challenge
description: A crisis is a test, and we have been found wanting.

description: Instead of making America again "a normal country in a normal time," as Jeane Kirkpatrick had urged, we set out on our path to empire.

name: Slaughter's key shot, 1,500th career point, helps Grain Valley to key conference win over Raytown
description: With Raytown making a late run at coach Randy Draper's Grain Valley girls basketball team, the Eagles needed a big play from their big playmaker.

description: Some key mistakes cost the Blue Springs South wrestling team a chance at a Suburban Big Eight victory Tuesday.

name: College-bound Jaxson McIntyre helps Blue Springs wrestling upend Park Hill
description: Jaxson McIntyre got the win that tied the match and then Mason Sullivan followed with a pin to break the tie. From there, Blue Springs won the next three, closing with six straight wins to pick up a 52-28 win over Park Hill in a Suburban Big Eight Conference dual Thursday at Blue Springs High School.

name: Mavericks take momentum into new year with pair of overtime wins over Wichita

description: Vesper Hall and the lobby of the Fieldhouse are open as warming centers during regular business hours Thursday and Friday.

description: These girls are sweet dogs who just need someone to love and care for them. Both are current on vaccinations and on heartworm preventative. One or both would make great companions to an adult or mature couple.

name: Chiefs' regular season finale at Denver moved to Saturday; Chargers-Raiders showdown for playoffs will close out season Sunday
description: The Kansas City Chiefs will be playing their regular season finale on Saturday. The Chiefs' game scheduled for 3:25 p.m. (CST) Sunday at Denver will be played at 3:30 p.m. Saturday instead. The NFL's other schedule changes for Week 18 will feature exactly what the league wanted: a Sunday night showdown for a playoff berth.
